page.title: 11Population In Notgrove
page.content: In this area, the main centre of population is the village of Notgrove, with about 100 adults and only a few children in about 30 houses. Most men work on the farm. The population is non-mobile, with only a few retired people in the village. Most of the cottages are owned by the Notgrove Estate, with only 2 or 3 privately owned. 1 or 2 cottages are let as weekend cottages. The rest of the area is populated by only a handful of houses scattered in the folds of the hills. One of these, on the main A436 road, offers Bed and Breakfast accommodation for passing motorists. It offers 4 double bedrooms, but trade has been poor this summer of 1985 partly due to the bad holiday weather.
